        - When the balance of caller is not smaller than the balance of caller:
          - the balance of caller will be updated to the balance of caller.

    - When (the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*ethpertoken) is not greater than the balance of owner:
      - When bonuspct is not greater than 0:
        - the balance of owner will be updated to (the balance of owner-(the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*ethpertoken)).
        - When (the balance of caller+(the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*ethpertoken)) is not smaller than the balance of caller:
          - the balance of caller will be updated to (the balance of caller+(the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*ethpertoken)).
      - When bonuspct is greater than 0:

          - the balance of owner will be updated to (the balance of owner-(the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*ethpertoken)).

            - the balance of caller will be updated to (the balance of caller+(the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*ethpertoken)).
        - When (the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*ethpertoken) is not smaller than (the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*ethpertoken), and ((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*ethpertoken)/100) equals to 0, and the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) is not smaller than bonusmineth:
          - the balance of owner will be updated to (the balance of owner-(the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*ethpertoken)).
          - When (the balance of caller+(the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*ethpertoken)) is not smaller than the balance of caller:
            - the balance of caller will be updated to (the balance of caller+(the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*ethpertoken)).
    - When bonuspct is greater than 0, and ((((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*ethpertoken)/100)*bonuspct)/((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*ethpertoken)/100)) equals to bonuspct, and ((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*ethpertoken)/100) does not equal to 0, and the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) is not smaller than bonusmineth, and ((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*ethpertoken)+(((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*ethpertoken)/100)*bonuspct)) is not smaller than (the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*ethpertoken), and ((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*ethpertoken)+(((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*ethpertoken)/100)*bonuspct)) is not greater than the balance of owner:
      - the balance of owner will be updated to (the balance of owner-((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*ethpertoken)+(((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*ethpertoken)/100)*bonuspct))).
      - When (the balance of caller+((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*ethpertoken)+(((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*ethpertoken)/100)*bonuspct))) is not smaller than the balance of caller:
        - the balance of caller will be updated to (the balance of caller+((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*ethpertoken)+(((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*ethpertoken)/100)*bonuspct))).

For the acceptOwnership function.
- For newowner:

    - the state variable newowner will be updated to 0.

For the transferFrom function, it has 3 arguments and the type of each argument is as follows: address, address, uint256.
- When the third argument is not greater than the balance of the first argument:
  - the balance of the first argument will be updated to (the balance of the first argument-the third argument).
  - When the third argument is not greater than the allowance from the first argument to caller:
    - the allowance from the first argument to caller will be updated to (the allowance from the first argument to caller-the third argument).
    - When (the balance of the second argument+the third argument) is not smaller than the balance of the second argument:
      - the balance of the second argument will be updated to (the balance of the second argument+the third argument).

For the burn function, it has one argument and its type is uint256.
- For owner, and the first argument is not greater than the balance of caller, and the first argument is greater than 0:
  - the balance of caller will be updated to (the balance of caller-the first argument).
  - When the first argument is not greater than totalSupply:
    - the state variable totalSupply will be updated to (totalSupply-the first argument).

For the approveAndCall function, it has 3 arguments and the type of each argument is as follows: address, uint256, bytes.
- the allowance from caller to the first argument will be updated to the second argument.
- When 0 is not smaller than the third argument:
  - it calls an external function receiveApproval of the first argument.
- When 0 is smaller than the third argument:
  - When 32 is not smaller than the third argument:
    - it calls an external function receiveApproval of the first argument.
  - When 32 is smaller than the third argument:
    - When 64 is not smaller than the third argument:
      - it calls an external function receiveApproval of the first argument.
    - When 64 is smaller than the third argument:
      - When 96 is not smaller than the third argument:
        - it calls an external function receiveApproval of the first argument.
      - When 96 is smaller than the third argument:
        - When 128 is not smaller than the third argument:
          - it calls an external function receiveApproval of the first argument.
        - When 160 is not smaller than the third argument, and 128 is smaller than the third argument:
          - it calls an external function receiveApproval of the first argument.

For the transfer function, it has 2 arguments and the type of each argument is as follows: address, uint256.
- When the second argument is not greater than the balance of caller:
  - the balance of caller will be updated to (the balance of caller-the second argument).
  - When (the balance of the first argument+the second argument) is not smaller than the balance of the first argument:
    - the balance of the first argument will be updated to (the balance of the first argument+the second argument).

For the transferOwnership function, it has one argument and its type is address.
- For owner:
  - the state variable newowner will be updated to the first argument.

For the transferAnyERC20Token function, it has 2 arguments and the type of each argument is as follows: address, uint256.
- For owner:
  - it calls an external function transfer of the first argument with the following argument list: owner, and the second argument.
